creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: domed top carved with 2 dragons with gilded details among waves; Ming-style imperial seal on bottom; sides carved with organic designs
marks:

on seal, on bottom: [Eternal collec
text: Cleverly moulded in the form of a large official seal, this ink cake has a pair of dragons cavorting amonst waves on its top. The reverse side, shown here, displays a Ming-style imperial seal-script legend in four large characters, <I>T'ien-fu yung-ts'ang<I> meaning, "eternal collection of the heavenly palace," This stick conforms in shape and concept to ink cakes made by the mid-eighteenth century ink maker, Wang Wei-kao.
title: Ink Stick in Seal Form
